      • withLruCacheOfSize

        public SELF withLruCacheOfSize(int maxSize)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder
        Enables Least-Recently-Used caching on the new ChronoDB instance.

        If this operation is called several times on the same builder instance, the last setting wins.

        Specified by:
        withLruCacheOfSize in interface ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder<SELF extends ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder<?>>
        Parameters:
        maxSize - The maximum number of elements to be contained in the LRU cache. If this number is less than or equal to zero, the caching is disabled instead.
        Returns:
        this, for method chaining.

      • assumeCachedValuesAreImmutable

        public SELF assumeCachedValuesAreImmutable(boolean value)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder
        Enables or disables the assumption that values in the cache of this ChronoDB instance are immutable.

        By default, this is set to false. Enabling this setting can greatly increase the speed of the cache, however cache state may be corrupted if cached values are changed by client code. This setting is only viable if the client ensures that the objects passed to the key-value store are effectively immutable.

        Specified by:
        assumeCachedValuesAreImmutable in interface ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder<SELF extends ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder<?>>
        Parameters:
        value - Set this to true to enable the assumption that cached value objects are immutable (optimistic, faster, see above), otherwise use false (pessimistic, default).
        Returns:
        this, for method chaining.

      • withLruQueryCacheOfSize

        public SELF withLruQueryCacheOfSize(int maxSize)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder
        Enables Least-Recently-Used caching on the new ChronoDB instance for query results.
        Specified by:
        withLruQueryCacheOfSize in interface ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder<SELF extends ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder<?>>
        Parameters:
        maxSize - The maximum number of elements to be contained in the LRU Query Result Cache. If this number is less than or equal to zero, the caching is disabled instead.
        Returns:
        this, for method chaining.

      • withDuplicateVersionElimination

        public SELF withDuplicateVersionElimination(boolean useDuplicateVersionElimination)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder
        Enables or disables duplicate version elimination on commit.

        If this is enabled, every changed key-value pair will be checked for identity with the previous version. Key-value pairs that are identical to their predecessors will be filtered out and will not be committed. This does not alter the semantics of the store in any way, but it eliminates the duplicates, reducing overall store size on disk and enhancing read performance.

        This setting is enabled by default and it is recommended to keep this setting enabled, unless the caller can guarantee that each version is different from the predecessor. In general, this feature will cause some overhead on the commit operation.

        Corresponds to ChronoDBConfiguration.DUPLICATE_VERSION_ELIMINATION_MODE.

        Specified by:
        withDuplicateVersionElimination in interface ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder<SELF extends ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder<?>>
        Parameters:
        useDuplicateVersionElimination - true to enable this feature, or false to disable it. Default is true.
        Returns:
        this, for method chaining.

      • withBlindOverwriteProtection

        public SELF withBlindOverwriteProtection(boolean enableBlindOverwriteProtection)
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder
        Enables or disables blind overwrite protection.

        If enabled, any commit that would overwrite a key-value pair written by a transaction with a higher timestamp will be rejected. In other words, if a commit has occurred on an entry, and this entry has never been visible to the current transaction, then this transaction is not allowed to "blindly overwrite" that entry.

        This setting is enabled by default and it is recommended to keep it enabled. In general, this feature will cause some overhead on the commit operation.

        Corresponds to ChronoDBConfiguration.ENABLE_BLIND_OVERWRITE_PROTECTION.

        Specified by:
        withBlindOverwriteProtection in interface ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder<SELF extends ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder<?>>
        Parameters:
        enableBlindOverwriteProtection - true to enable this feature, or false to disable it. Default is true.
        Returns:
        this, for method chaining.

      • build

        public ChronoDB build()
        Description copied from interface: ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder
        Builds the ChronoDB instance, using the properties specified by the fluent API.

        This method finalizes the build process. Afterwards, the builder should be discarded.

        Specified by:
        build in interface ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder<SELF extends ChronoDBFinalizableBuilder<?>>
        Returns:
        The new ChronoDB instance. Never null.
